thread.title: Oregon school shooting: How can I help?
thread.title_full: Oregon school shooting: How can I help? | OregonLive.com

author: Molly Young | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon school shooting: How can I help?
text:
Oregonians who want to help victims of a Thursday shooting that left 10 people dead at Umpqua Community College near Roseburg can donate money to two relief funds:
1) Roseburg-based Umpqua Bank and Greater Douglas United Way partnered to set up the UCC Relief Fund. All of the money will help those affected by the shooting, organizers say. People can contribute to it at any Umpqua branch. The bank donated $25,000 itself.
2) Cascade Community Credit Union also set up a fund to assist people affected by the tragedy. To donate, people can stop into any of the credit union's three Douglas County locations, said the credit union's chief executive Bob Dempsey.
The American Red Cross has also set up an area at the Douglas County Fairgrounds for families to gather. Mental health help is available, spokeswoman Paula Negele said.
Hear from students, community leaders after UCC shooting Watch a compilation of videos from dispatch communication to student reaction after Umpqua Community College shooting.
She said the Red Cross has not received any requests for blood, but is ready to put out the call for donors if one arrives.
Mercy Medical Center in Roseburg will have a blood donation van on site tomorrow at noon at the west parking lot for anyone who wants to donate.
Know of other ways to help? Email the reporter, and we will add it to the list.
-- Molly Young
